item.title: Chapter 14: Give momentum to your samples
Stochastic Parameterizations for Uncertainty, Prediction and Control
item.description: Solving partial differential euqations using computers is done by converting it into ode via discretizations so that one can represent the systems using a finite degree of freedoms such that our approximations are still valid and we are able to estimate and solve the system at a coarser level. What this means is that we only use a finite number of points to represent a line, a finite number of area elements and a finite number of volume elements to construct algebraic equations in order to solve them using the computer.
